entry.et: Middle English furren, from Anglo-French furrer to stuff, fill, line, from fuerre sheath, of Germanic origin; akin to Old High German fuotar sheath; akin to Greek pōma lid, cover, Sanskrit pāti he protects

def.dt: :to cover, line, trim, or clothe with fur
:to coat or clog as if with fur
:to become coated or clogged as if with fur
:a piece of the dressed pelt of an animal used to make, trim, or line wearing apparel
:an article of clothing made of or with fur
:the hairy coat of a mammal especially when fine, soft, and thick
:a coat of epithelial debris on the tongue
:the thick pile of a fabric (as chenille)
:any of two genera (Callorhinus and Arctocephalus) of eared seals that have a double coat with a dense soft underfur
